alert.note: Alert for Prairie (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 24 at 7:53PM CDT until May 04 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Arkansas... White River At Georgetown affecting Woodruff, Prairie and White Counties. White River At Des Arc affecting Prairie County. White River At Augusta affecting Woodruff and White Counties. White River At Clarendon affecting Monroe and Arkansas Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY, MAY 04... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River At Des Arc. * WHEN...Until Thursday, May 04. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, Water is backing up Bayou Des Arc and Cypress Bayou. West Park Drive is inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Monday the stage was 25.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain nearly steady. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 7 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Crest Time Date White River Des Arc 24.0 25.8 Mon 7 PM 25.5 25.2 25.0 Nearly steady &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
